title: Maharashtra civic polls: 68 Mahayuti candidates elected unopposed, including 44 of BJP
content: This includes 44 of the BJP, with the highest number being from Kalyan-Dombivli Municipal Corporation in Thane district, followed by Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad, Panvel, Bhiwandi, Dhule, Jalgaon and Ahilyanagar

title: Man arrested in Bihar's Muzaffarpur for circulating AI-generated fake videos of PM, President
content: The accused has been identified as Pramod Kumar Raj, a resident of Bhagwanpur in the Bochaha police station area

title: First community radio station along LoC comes up in J&K's Rajouri
content: Officials said this is the first community radio station on the LoC, which aims to counter misinformation and propaganda from across the border

title: Zelenskyy says he wants to replace Ukraine‚Äôs Defence Minister
content: Mikhailo Fedorov, who has been the Minister of Digital Transformation since 2019 was the position of the new Ukrainian Defence Minister

title: The Aravalli hills are shaken with the sound of machinery
content: A 2-billion-year-old range has been battered and bruised by mining, waste dumping, and encroachment, say environmentalists and those who live in its shadow. The Supreme Court order accepting the changed definition of the Aravalli hills caused further worry, though it has since been stayed.¬†Ishita Mishra¬†reports on the people living in the foothills, who believe that decisions about the Aravallis should involve and benefit communities

title: Signature campaign in Kolkata to protect tamarind tree planted by revolutionary 70 years ago
content: A movement to save the tree was started in July 2024 after builders took over the property where the freedom fighter lived and when it seemed the tree would be taken down anytime

title: Nalagarh blast: Two groups claim responsibility; Himachal police scans CCTV footage to nab accused
content: Teams have been constituted to scan CCTV footage, and the police are coordinating with the Punjab Police and the National Investigation Agency (NIA) for the probe

title: LoP Suvendu Adhikari calls West Bengal a ‚ÄòBengali Hindu homeland‚Äô
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party MLA said that once the saffron party will provide 200 days of rural work, countering Trinamool‚Äôs claim that it will provide 100 days on employment under Karmashree Prakalpa

title: Police ask X to remove video of assault on migrant worker
content: The incident occurred on December 26 near the railway quarters in Tiruttani, where 4 juveniles attacked the man from Odisha with a weapon. They recorded the act and uploaded it online

title: NIA shifts a Delhi blast accused to Kashmir, scans forest area in Shopian
content: Multiple teams of the NIA reached Padpawan area of Shopian district along with Yasir Dar, the ninth accused in the case. Officials said a forest area was scanned based on the questioning of the accused

title: Aviation sector to take wings in A.P. as Bhogapuram airport all set for flight validation test on January 4
content: The project undertaken during the NDA‚Äôs tenure between 2014 and 2019 after the State bifurcation is expected to be ready by June 30

title: Distribution of pattadar passbooks with State Emblem begins in A.P.
content: Naidu, who is abroad, reviews the exercise through teleconference; 22 lakh passbooks will be distributed in villages where re-survey has been completed

title: Natural disasters taking heavy toll on Himachal, says report; experts seek policy changes
content: The Himachal Pradesh Human Development Report 2025 said that as Himachal continues to grapple with shifting weather patterns and an increasing number of natural disasters, the economic losses have been high and the human toll substantial

title: Nitish Kumar seeks union government help for better upkeep of Kumhrar Park maintained by ASI
content: He gave the instruction during the inspection of the park and the historical site located in Patna. The Chief Minister also viewed the remains of pillars from the Magadha Empire period preserved in the Kumhrar Park complex.

title: EOW of Odisha police arrest financial fraudster accused of swindling ‚Çπ120 crore
content: Arrested from Bankura district of West Bengal, the accused Amit Mandal had collected deposits from 600 gullible investors

title: Reduce number of shops on Marina Beach, HC tells Corporation
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and A.D. Jagadish Chandira suggest that only eatables, toys & souvenirs should be sold in the beach

title: India‚Äôs deep dive into the frozen frontier
content: A team of scientists, including one from Hyderabad-based INCOIS, has successfully deployed and retrieved an autonomous ocean glider in the Southern Ocean, marking a big leap in the country‚Äôs polar and deep-ocean research capabilities

title: Historic bell set to ring again at 172-year-old church in Secunderabad
content: Restoration of 80-foot bell tower using traditional lime-and-mortar techniques nears completion; tower commemorates missionary Lillian Burgess, who perished in a 19th-century shipwreck while bringing a bell for the church

title: Theyyam to light up Thiruvananthapuram during Assembly book festival
content: Fourth edition of the Kerala Legislative Assembly International Book Festival will be organised from January 7 to 13

title: Government to help teachers use AI; will ease open schooling framework
content: Education Ministry hopes Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill will pass during Budget Session; wants to create pathways for non-school institutes, such as ITIs, to offer open schooling programmes under NIOS

title: Health scheme for ex-servicemen facing crisis due to govt. apathy, says Congress
content: Congress says the Centre has reduced budget allocations for the medical scheme benefitting ex-servicemen; the party will start an agitation if the government does not release funds by January 30

title: Supreme Court condemns denial of bail to give accused a ‚Äòtaste of imprisonment as a lesson‚Äô
content: Even if allegations are serious, every undertrial should be presumed innocent, court tells enforcement agencies

title: QB Reed says he'll return to Texas A&M for '26
content: Marcel Reed announced Friday that he will return to Texas A&M for the 2026 season after leading the Aggies to their first CFP appearance.

title: Sources: Ole Miss QB Simmons plans portal entry
content: Former Ole Miss starting quarterback Austin Simmons is expected to enter the transfer portal, sources told ESPN. He is likely headed to Missouri, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel.

title: Finland stuns U.S. in world junior hockey quarters
content: Finland stunned the two-time defending champion United States 4-3 on Friday night in the world junior hockey quarterfinals.

title: Sources: Sorsby, top portal QB, to visit TTU, LSU
content: Quarterback Brendan Sorsby, the top player in the transfer portal, will visit Texas Tech and LSU, sources told ESPN. Sorsby combined for 36 touchdowns this season for Cincinnati.

title: Steelers' Watt feels 'no limitations,' set for return
content: T.J. Watt said he is looking forward to his return from a punctured lung and that he hasn't discussing playing on a snap count against the Ravens.

title: Diggs, Barmore decline to discuss facing charges
content: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs and defensive tackle Christian Barmore both declined to comment on the pending charges against each player in separate assault cases.

title: Source: Jags extend Van Lanen for 3 years, $51M
content: The Jaguars and offensive lineman Cole Van Lanen agreed on a three-year, $51 million extension, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter. The deal includes $32.5 million guaranteed and could be worth up to $55.5 million with incentives.

title: McVay to play L.A. starters regardless of seeding
content: Even if the Rams are locked into their seed on Sunday, coach Sean McVay plans to play his healthy starters against the Cardinals.

title: üçº Jordan Love, Ronika Stone expecting 1st child
content: The Green Bay Packers quarterback and pro volleyball player announced her pregnancy on New Year's day.

title: Our guide to every Week 18 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions and what's at stake
content: Must-win AFC North and NFC South showdowns. No. 1 seeds on the line. We have picks, stats and more for every game.

title: Game plans for 10 teams that need Week 18 wins
content: Ten teams are trying to secure spots, division titles or top seeds, and we found one thing each of them must do.

title: CFP semifinals first look: Previewing the penultimate round
content: How each team can win its semifinal game, plus key players and what we learned from the quarterfinals.

title: 67 points and a 'transfer portal' surprise: Nonconference hoops superlatives
content: As conference play begins, we hand out superlatives for some of the best on- and off-court moments from nonconference play.

title: NBA insiders predict 2026: Why LeBron, trade sagas, expansion news could rock the league
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the stars, sagas and storylines that will dominate 2026.

title: Stories of Bills' Highmark Stadium tunnel ahead of final game: 'Ours is dumb'
content: The Bills' old tunnel will forever be a hallmark to those who experienced it -- and those players told us their stories.

title: LaLiga is back! Can Real Madrid beat leaders Bar√ßa to title?
content: Here's all you need to know about the 2025-26 LaLiga season so far before it resumes this weekend following the winter break in Spain.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Maresca-less Chelsea visit Man City, Barcelona derby, more
content: The post-Enzo Maresca era at Chelsea begins. Plus, huge derbies in Scotland and France and much more.

title: Where do labor talks stand one week before deadline?
content: Here's the latest on proposed salary caps and why the two sides are debating gross and net revenue ahead of the Jan. 9 deadline.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Rodrygo lined up by Arsenal, Man City
content: Premier League sides Arsenal and Manchester City are potential destinations for Real Madrid's Rodrygo.

title: Men's January transfer grades: Spurs get an A for Johnson's Palace move
content: Here is how we rated the biggest deals, with Brennan Johnson moving from Tottenham to Crystal Palace.

title: Why the World Cup could delay some MLS-based USMNT stars' European dreams
content: The USMNT has several breakout stars in MLS who, in years past, would've jumped at a January move abroad. In 2026, though, they might have to sit tight.

title: DFS and Pick 6 plays: Week 18's biggest decisions to make, top stacks and more
content: From building blocks to intriguing stacks and value plays, our DFS guide offers the advice you need for Week 18.

title: What to watch as the 2026 season begins
content: Can Jordan Chiles lead UCLA to the title? Will Oklahoma win again? All your questions answered as the NCAA gymnastics season starts Friday.

title: Two arrested for raping 2 children of tribal labourers in Maharashtra
content: The two girls did not speak about the incident for four days as the two accused had threatened them with dire consequences; the incident came to light when one of them needed medical attention after complaining of pain

title: Barred from Jama Masjid, Mirwaiz‚Äôs online sermon calls for ‚Äòdialogue on Kashmir‚Äô
content: ‚ÄúDespite making unilateral changes in 2019, the reality is that the Kashmir conflict continues to keep the region in an unsettled state that can erupt anytime‚Äù

title: BJP alleges ‚Äòmaha jungle raj‚Äô in Bengal, says Mamata ‚Äòthreatened‚Äô Amit Shah
content: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia says Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had threatened Union Home Minister Amit Shah from entering the State

title: Congress alleges 15 deaths in Indore as official toll stands at 5
content: Team of senior doctors will analyse media reports of deaths related to drinking water contamination¬†and update official figures, says Collector; two senior municipal corporation officials suspended as Congress seeks accountability and action

title: Community workshop on Spinal Muscular Atrophy held in Thiruvananthapuram
content: SMA is a rare neuromuscular disorder characterised by the degeneration of motor neurons, leading to progressive muscle weakness and wasting

title: CEC member visits Bannerghatta National Park, interacts with farmers
content: The petition argued that the notification regarding the reduction of the ESZ has excluded ecologically critical areas surrounding established elephant corridors

title: Tourist access to Kashmir‚Äôs¬†Margan Top, Chauhar Nag, Sinthan Top banned over security
content: According to an order issued by the SDM, Kokernag, inputs from police and security agencies indicated security vulnerabilities in certain high-altitude and forested areas

title: ED arrests IAS officer from Gujarat in bribery-linked money laundering case
content: Rajendrakumar Patel, a 2015-batch IAS officer, was serving as Surendranagar Collector until he was transferred without a new posting last week

title: Karur MP flags ‚Äònon-cooperation‚Äô by TNCC in naming booth-level agents
content: Jothimani alleges that she was facing obstructions in submitting the list of polling booth agents to the Election Commission and says TNCC is in the news for all wrong reasons

title: Land acquisition a major issue in infrastructure development: Cabinet Secretary
content: The government has not calculated the savings due to timely monitoring of the schemes by PRAGATI portal, says Cabinet Secretary

title: Madurai Bench of Madras High Court imposes restrictions on Santhanakoodu Urus on the Thirupparankundram¬†hill
content: Justice S.¬†Srimathy¬†restrains the¬†dargah¬†authorities from carrying out animal sacrifice, carrying meat and non-vegetarian food, and cooking non-vegetarian food. The direction should be enforced from the foothills to the top, the court has said

title: Vellappally-Binoy Viswam spat takes an ugly turn
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan  moderates his stance against Vellappally, saying his party¬†will not ¬†consider him a communal bigot for an isolated remark

title: IT Ministry orders X to ‚Äòaudit‚Äô and cease morphed pictures of women in Grok chatbot
content: The Ministry ordered the social media platform to undertake a ‚Äúcomprehensive audit‚Äù of its AI chatbot to ensure it does not generate such imagery

title: Activists allege threatening calls ahead of public hearing on proposal for a chemical factory
content: The residents of Malgi village oppose proposal to set up high-risk chemical industry in their village

title: Country has a poor record in retrieving stolen antiques
content: Of the 31 antique idols stolen from protected sites, monuments, and temples in the country in the recent past, only four could be retrieved by the enforcement agencies. Though no antique theft has been reported from the ASI-protected sites in Kerala, there have been other cases of antique theft

title: CCI unlikely to source cotton from Tamil Nadu this year
content: There are three main norms that should be met by a State so that the CCI can purchase cotton from the farmers. Area under cotton in a taluk should be minimum 3,000 hectares and there should be a ginning factory and a market centre in that area, says a senior official

title: Govt. to bring in regulations to cap intake of computer science and related engineering courses
content: Minister says the Department of Higher Education will form a one-man committee to study and submit the report

title: Govt. launches mental health training for medical students
content: Ties up with U.S.-based Question, Persuade, Refer Institute India to provide a structured programme in all medical colleges in the State with an aim to prevent suicides and reduce mental stress among the students

title: Remarks by Uttarakhand Minister‚Äôs husband trigger row
content: Girdhari Lal Sahu, husband of Uttarakhand Women and Child Development Minister Rekha Arya, said that ‚Äògirls are sold for ‚Çπ20,000 to ‚Çπ25,000 in Bihar‚Äô; Opposition parties and even BJP in Bihar refused to accept the explanation given by Mr. Sahu, who also happens to be a BJP member

title: KPOA calls for gender-neutral recruitment across police ranks
content: Association says such a move will enable a higher proportion of women to join the force organically over long term

title: GBA warns civic agencies against unauthorised road-cutting
content: To improve coordination and reduce disruption, the Chief Commissioner instructed all departments to prepare and submit advance lists of proposed road-cutting works. He also asked them to map the roads identified for cutting on Google Maps, clearly indicating the length of each stretch, and share the information with all city corporations

title: Couple charred to death in hut at village near Chengam in Tiruvannamalai
content: Unidentified persons had reportedly set the hut on fire after locking the door from the outside. Special police teams have been formed to nab the suspects

title: Tribal body rejects bid for ST status to six Assam communities
content: The recommendations of the State government are illegal, unconstitutional, and aimed at destroying the political rights of the existing tribes, says the Coordination Committee of Tribal Organisations of Assam

title: Modernisation, communication key to policing future challenges: State Police Chief
content: He calls for greater transparency and openness within the force and says officers should be encouraged to speak about work-related stress, mental health challenges

title: TN shocker: Man, live-in partner charred to death as group locks hut, sets it on fire
content: A 53-year-old man and his live-in partner were found charred to death in their hut in Tiruvannamalai district after it was allegedly set on fire by unidentified individuals. Police are investigating the suspicious deaths, considering potential involvement of the victims' estranged spouses. The couple had been living together for three years.

title: Delhi AQI improves to ‚Äòpoor‚Äô at 235; GRAP Stage-III lifted
content: Delhi's Air Quality Index has improved to 'poor' after being in the 'very poor' category, with a daily average AQI of 235 recorded. Favorable meteorological conditions led to the revocation of Stage-III of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP). Authorities urge continued adherence to GRAP Stages II and I to prevent further deterioration.

title: Now, Pakistan backs China's claim that it mediated during Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan has now endorsed China's claim of mediating the May 2025 India-Pakistan conflict, a move that raises eyebrows given India's stance.  Islamabad's foreign office spokesperson stated Chinese leaders were in contact with both nations, contributing to de-escalation. This assertion contrasts with India's position that the conflict pause followed a request from Pakistan's DGMO, not third-party intervention.

title: Trump invites Japan's Takaichi to US; focus on Indo-Pacific
content: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi has accepted an invitation from US President Donald Trump to visit the United States this spring. The leaders discussed strengthening the Japan-US alliance and promoting a free and open Indo-Pacific region. The visit, potentially in late March, follows recent regional tensions and Takaichi's remarks on Taiwan.

title: 'The end of me': Google's Eric Schmidt on AI; says 55 years of coding wiped out
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt believes AI's rapid advancement, already handling 10-20% of programming tasks, signals the end of traditional coding careers. He sees AI's true economic power in automating corporate functions like billing and accounting, not just coding. Schmidt also predicts Artificial General Intelligence by 2029, urging human oversight to preserve agency.

title: IND vs NZ: Vijay Hazare- Rishabh Pant at the heart of a fierce selection debate
content: Rishabh Pant's place in India's ODI squad is under scrutiny despite his past success. With a new captain and coaching philosophy emphasizing flexibility, selectors face a dilemma. Former players urge consistency, warning against repeating past mistakes and highlighting the need to either fully back Pant or identify a clear backup wicketkeeper before the next World Cup.

title: 'Ikkis' BO collection day 2: Agastya, Dharmendra‚Äôs war drama mints over Rs 12 crore worldwide
content: Agastya Nanda's debut in 'Ikkis' has opened to a strong Rs 7 crore on its first day, with a Rs 3.5 crore collection on day 2, bringing the India net total to Rs 10.5 crore. The war drama, featuring Dharmendra's last appearance, has outperformed 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' but trails behind the reigning 'Dhurandhar'.

title: Tesla's former AI boss: Google Waymo cannot match Tesla's self-driving tech; explains why
content: Former Tesla AI chief Andrej Karpathy believes Google's Waymo couldn't replicate Tesla's recent coast-to-coast autonomous drive. He highlighted Tesla's end-to-end neural network versus Waymo's modular system, which struggled during a San Francisco power outage. Karpathy praised the milestone despite recent criticism from Elon Musk about his "dated" views.

title: Indore water contamination: 200 still hospitalised, 32 in ICUs
content: Madhya Pradesh government took action following a contaminated water tragedy in Indore, removing municipal commissioner Dilip Kumar Yadav and suspending additional commissioner Rohit Sisoniya. The move comes as the death toll from the outbreak rose to 10. An in-charge superintendent engineer was also removed, with new officials appointed.

title: ‚ÄòI will do jihad soon‚Äô: How Christian Sturdivant planned New Year‚Äôs Eve 'terrorist attack'
content: In a shocking turn of events, North Carolina's own 18-year-old Christian Sturdivant was apprehended just before the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve. Investigators are alleging that he orchestrated a chilling plot, inspired by ISIS, targeting a local grocery store.

title: Gill returns to domestic cricket; but you can‚Äôt watch him: Here's why
content: Shubman Gill‚Äôs Vijay Hazare Trophy match for Punjab against Sikkim will be played behind closed doors, similar to recent games involving Virat Kohli. As per BCCI guidelines, no spectators or live broadcast will be allowed due to security concerns and lack of seating at the Jaipuria College ground. Gill and Arshdeep Singh will also play Punjab‚Äôs next match against Goa on January 6.

title: Elon Musk's father Errol Musk says 'America will collapse if ‚Ä¶'
content: Errol Musk, father of Tesla CEO Elon Musk, has sparked controversy with remarks predicting a US 'collapse' due to the white population becoming a minority within two decades. He also downplayed systemic oppression in South Africa, claiming white populations significantly contributed to Black African development.

title: Bullet rain in Delhi: After Rs 3 crore extortion call, 2 dozen shots fired at businessman's car
content: A businessman's car and home in Rohini were targeted with over two dozen gunshots in a brazen extortion attempt.  The attack, demanding Rs 3 crore, suggests the return of gangster Himanshu Bhau, believed to be in the US.  Police are investigating the incident, which involved extensive gunfire and threats received via WhatsApp.

title: Close call: Plane with 55 onboard skids off runway in Nepal; video shows damaged aircraft
content: A Buddha Air aircraft overshot the runway while landing at Nepal's Bhadrapur Airport on Friday night, with all 51 passengers and four crew members escaping uninjured. The plane skidded off the airstrip by nearly 200 meters, coming to a halt in a grassy area with minor damage. A technical team has been dispatched to assess the aircraft.

title: Major boost: Govt clears 22 electronics parts projects at Rs 42,000 crore investment
content: India's electronics manufacturing sector receives a significant boost with 22 new component manufacturing proposals approved, attracting nearly Rs 42,000 crore in investments. Major players like Samsung, Foxconn, and Tata Electronics are set to enhance domestic production, aiming to reduce import reliance and bolster the nation's position as a global manufacturing hub.

title: Coloured diamonds shine brighter: Why are ultra rich chasing pink, blue stones?
content: Ultra-wealthy Indians are increasingly investing in rare pink, blue, and yellow diamonds, driving a 20-25% demand surge. These coloured stones, far rarer than white diamonds, are seen as both fashion statements and lucrative long-term assets. Their rising prices are fueled by global trends and increasing scarcity, with significant appreciation over the past two decades.

title: Govt directs X to remove all obscene, unlawful content; lens on AI app Grok
content: The Indian government has ordered social media platform X to immediately remove all obscene, sexually explicit, and unlawful content, particularly that generated by its AI app Grok. The Ministry of Electronics and IT issued a notice citing failure to comply with IT Act rules and demanding an action report within 72 hours, warning of legal consequences for non-compliance.

title: ‚ÄòThackeray no longer a brand‚Äô: Fadnavis says Mumbai mayor will be Marathi Hindu
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis declared the BJP is unconcerned by the Thackeray cousins uniting, stating their political brand has faded. He asserted the Mahayuti will win decisively, with a Hindu Marathi mayor for Mumbai. Fadnavis also claimed credit for realizing key infrastructure projects like the Atal Setu and coastal road, highlighting his efforts in overcoming hurdles.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 29: Ranveer Singh starrer crosses Rs 1160 crore mark worldwide
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its reign at the box office, crossing Rs 1160 crore worldwide in its 5th week. The action-packed spy thriller has outperformed all regional, national, and international releases since its debut, demonstrating remarkable staying power and consistent audience engagement.

title: Delhi air pollution: City wriggles out of GRAP-III grip; yellow alert issued for dense fog
content: Delhi's air quality improved significantly on Friday, leading to the revocation of GRAP stage-III restrictions. Overnight winds helped clear pollutants, though the AQI is expected to turn very poor again from Sunday. The Municipal Corporation of Delhi also intensified its anti-pollution drive, issuing thousands of challans and sealing illegal units.

title: SC to courts: Impose timelines in probes only if there's delay
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that courts should generally avoid setting deadlines for investigations, as this infringes on the agency's autonomy. Timelines are only to be imposed reactively when there's clear evidence of unjustified delay or stagnation, ensuring a balance between prompt justice and the complexities of probes.

title: Indore water deaths: BJP corporator had raised red flag; files did not move
content: Deaths in Indore's water contamination tragedy could have been avoided if warnings from a BJP corporator two years ago were heeded. Corporator Kamal Waghela had repeatedly alerted the Indore Municipal Corporation about old, worn-out pipelines in Bhagirathpura, alleging officials delayed necessary replacements.

title: Delhi hikes EWS income cap for healthcare 2X; revised norms notified by DGHS
content: Delhi's government has significantly boosted free healthcare access for low-income families by raising the annual income ceiling for EWS patients to Rs 5 lakh, up from Rs 2.20 lakh. This move, aligning with school admission criteria, will allow more poor individuals to receive free treatment in identified private hospitals across the capital.

title: 'Bihari girls available for marriage for Rs 25k': U'khand minister's husband sparks row
content: An inflammatory claim made by Rekha Arya's husband, a minister from Uttarakhand, has sparked a firestorm of criticism. His insinuation that Bihari girls can be wed off cheaply has drawn sharp rebukes from political factions in Bihar, including allies in the ruling NDA.

title: Karnataka may scrap G-RAM-G, mulls own rural jobs scheme
content: Karnataka's cabinet has strongly opposed the Centre's new rural employment scheme, G-RAM-G, deeming it a blow to federalism and the right to work. The state is exploring its own rural employment guarantee program, potentially foregoing central funding to protect jobs and local development. This move comes as the new scheme shifts funding responsibilities to states.

title: Charlie Kirk killing video sparks questions as Brian Harpole footage spreads
content: A new video showing Brian Harpole before Charlie Kirk‚Äôs shooting has sparked strong online debate. Some viewers call his actions suspicious, while others see nothing wrong. Candace Owens has raised questions but shared no proof. Police say Tyler Robinson is the only suspect, and no official finding links Harpole to the killing.

title: York family net worth: How a $13 million bet became the 49ers‚Äô $8.4 billion empire
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: Paulina Gretzky net worth 2025: Inside Wayne Gretzky‚Äôs daughter‚Äôs wealth
content: The daughter of a legendary hockey player, Wayne Gretzky, and a wife to a pro golf player, Dustin Johnson, Paulina Gretzky has established her own way in the industry of entertainment and social media. Having a net worth of five million dollars, she has been successful in business, modeling, and acting. It has also been reported that she will inherit a large portion of her father's fortune.

title: Punjab police suspect ISI hand in Himachal Pradesh blast
content: Punjab police suspect Pakistan's ISI orchestrated Thursday's explosion in Nalagarh, Himachal Pradesh, to destabilize the region. While Babbar Khalsa International and Punjab Sovereignty Alliance claimed responsibility, police dismissed their ideological claims, stating these groups act on ISI's behalf.

title: Nagpur parents go to work, chain 12-yr-old 'habitual thief' at home
content: A 12-year-old boy in Nagpur was rescued after being chained and locked by his parents for hours daily over two months due to alleged cellphone theft. The school dropout, showing injuries from restraints and signs of trauma, has been moved to a government home for children. Police are investigating the incident.

title: Abhishek Banerjee presents 3 'dead' voters at TMC rally; takes on EC, BJP
content: Trinamool Congress's Abhishek Banerjee launched the party's 2026 election campaign by highlighting alleged voter roll discrepancies. He presented individuals marked as deceased, accusing the Election Commission of targeting Bengalis and questioning the deletion of Bangladeshi names. Banerjee criticized the BJP for issuing notices to common people for SIR hearings, drawing parallels to demonetization.

title: 'Know where to aim': Iran warns Trump over threat; violent protests rock Tehran
content: Iran's foreign minister has firmly rejected US President Trump's warning over protests, calling it reckless interference. He stated demonstrations were driven by economic woes and largely peaceful, with authorities addressing isolated violent incidents. Iran's armed forces are on standby, vowing to forcefully reject any external involvement in their internal affairs.

title: Madhyamik admit card as 14th SIR document? Bengal CEO urges Election Commission to clarify
content: West Bengal's Chief Electoral Officer has sought clarification from the Election Commission on accepting Madhyamik admit cards as a valid birth document. Currently, matriculation certificates are accepted, but if approved, admit cards could become the 14th document, potentially making Bengal the first state to allow this. This move stems from numerous pleas during SIR hearings.

title: Is Giannis Antetokounmpo playing vs Hornets tonight? Latest Jan 2 update
content: Milwaukee Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable for tonight's game against the Charlotte Hornets. His presence is crucial as the Hornets face significant frontcourt injuries. If Giannis plays, the Bucks are heavily favored to control the game. The team is managing his calf injury carefully. Other key Bucks players are available.

title: Pulwama cricketer wears helmet with Palestinian flag sticker; cops start probe
content: A cricketer's use of a Palestinian flag sticker on his helmet at a Jammu tournament sparked a police probe and political debate. While some condemned it as promoting separatism, others defended it as solidarity, questioning selective outrage. The JKCA disassociated itself from the private event, leaving authorities to investigate the incident's intent and implications.

title: Sparklers & champagne: New photos show moment blaze erupted in Swiss bar
content: Photos have emerged showing lit sparklers attached to bottles inside a packed nightclub in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana at the moment a deadly fire broke out during New Year‚Äôs Eve celebrations. The blaze at Le Constellation killed at least 40 people and injured more than 100, with videos showing panic as exits were blocked by the spreading fire.

title: Zach Bryan marries Samantha Leonard; country singer confirms wedding with Instagram post
content: The irreverent country star Zach Bryan has tied the knot. The 29-year-old singer confirmed his marriage to Samantha Leonard, 28, with a low-key Instagram post that stayed true to his stripped-down public persona. Bryan shared the news on Thursday, posting a photo of himself holding Leonard close.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls the pain after learning of Kobe and Gianna‚Äôs tragic deaths
content: It will soon be six years since Kobe Bryant and his teenage daughter, Gianna Bryant, passed away in a horrific healicopter crash in 2020. While Vanessa Bryant has remained strong even in such circumstances, she has opened up about the pain she felt when she heard about the crash and what happened to her husband and her teenage daughter in 2020.

title: After VPN ban in Kashmir, J&K Police acts against over 100 users
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police have initiated action against over 100 individuals, including teenagers, for violating prohibitory orders on VPN usage. While no terror links were found, security proceedings were initiated as a preventive measure, with warnings issued to refrain from future violations. The ban was imposed citing national security threats and potential misuse to incite unrest.

title: Property of 7 people accused in UAPA attached in Kathua
content: Kathua Police in Jammu have attached land worth crores belonging to seven individuals residing in Pakistan. Cases under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act and EIMCO Act have been registered against them. This action underscores the police's commitment to combating unlawful and anti-national activities.

title: ‚ÄòAbhishek following Rahul‚Äô: Cong, TMC spar over credit for exposing ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô
content: Trinamool's Abhishek Banerjee accused Congress and other parties of misunderstanding the "vote chori" issue, claiming it happens through electoral rolls, not EVMs. He stressed ground-level booth fights over social media campaigns. Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury sharply retorted, accusing Banerjee of copying Rahul Gandhi's agenda and questioning his anti-BJP silence.

title: Vitamin B12 in eggs: How to cook eggs right to get maximum vitamins
content: Eggs are a natural source of vitamin B12, crucial for nerve function and energy. Researchers found cooking methods affect nutrient availability. Gentle cooking like soft boiling, poaching, low-heat frying, and steaming best preserves vitamin B12. Overcooking, especially the yolk, diminishes its nutritional value. Simple adjustments in heat and time can maximize the benefits of this everyday food.

title: Radio Sangam: 1st Community Radio Station Along LoC Comes Up In J&K's Rajouri
content: The first community radio station along the Line of Control has been set up in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district, strengthening information outreach in border areas, officials said.

title: From Subway Ride To Israel Backlash: Mamdani's First Full Day As NYC Mayor
content: Less than 24 hours after throngs of ecstatic supporters poured into Manhattan for his history-making inauguration, Zohran Mamdani began his first full day of work with a routine familiar to many New Yorkers.

title: Deadly Swiss Bar Fire Started From Sparklers Or Bengal Candles: Officials
content: A fire at Le Constellation bar killed 40 New Year's revellers and most of the 119 survivors were in a critical condition.

title: "Can't Eat, Sleep": Owners Of Swiss Bar Where Fire Killed 40 Break Silence
content: Jessica Moretti was there at the time of the disaster and had suffered minor injuries but had been able to return home.

title: "Bihar Girls Available For Marriage For Rs 20,000": Uttarakhand Minister's Husband Sparks Row
content: Girdhari Lal Sahu, husband of Uttarakhand minister Rekha Arya, has stoked a controversy for purportedly saying girls from Bihar are available for marriage at Rs 20,000-Rs 25,000.

title: Delhi Legislative Assembly Winter Session To Begin On January 5
content: The winter session of the Delhi legislative assembly will commence on January 5 (Monday) and will go on till January 8.

title: 2 Dead, 50 Houses Damaged As 6.5-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Mexico
content: A 6.5-magnitude earthquake rattled Mexico's capital and a tourist hotspot on the Pacific coast on Friday, killing at least two people and causing moderate damage in a small town near the epicenter.

title: "BJP Works Independently, Not Remote Controlled By RSS": Mohan Bhagwat
content: Mohan Bhagwat is on a two-day visit to Bhopal as part of the RSS's centenary-related activities across the country.

title: Iran's Protests: What We Know So Far
content: Iran has been rocked this week by protests that started in Tehran and have spread to other cities, with at least six people killed in clashes with security forces.

title: Yemen Separatists Launch 2-Year Independence Transition As Strikes Kill 20
content: Yemen's UAE-backed separatists announced a two-year transition to independence Friday despite reporting 20 deaths in airstrikes from a Saudi-led coalition trying to roll back their weeks-long offensive across the country's south.

title: Elon Musk's Grok Under Fire After Complaints It Undressed Minors In Photos
content: Elon Musk's Grok on Friday said it was scrambling to fix flaws in the artificial intelligence tool after users claimed it turned pictures of children or women into erotic images.

title: "Not Pre-Planned": DK Shivakumar Denies BJP's Allegations Over Ballari Clash
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar has refuted the allegations levelled by the opposition Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) that the violent clash in Ballari was a "pre-planned conspiracy", urging people to wait for the inquiry report on the matter.

title: Properties Of 7 Pak-Based Men Attached In Jammu And Kashmir's Kathua
content: Police on Friday attached immovable properties of seven people from Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district who are allegedly involved in anti-national activities while operating from Pakistan, officials said.

title: 11 People Killed, 7 Injured As Bus And Truck Collide In Brazil
content: A head-on collision between a bus and a truck left at least 11 people dead on Friday in southern Brazil, the country's Federal Highway Police said in a statement.

title: 'US Bases Legitimate Targets': Iran After Trump's "Locked-Loaded" Warning
content: US President Donald Trump and top Iranian officials exchanged duelling threats Friday as widening economic protests swept across parts of the Islamic Republic, further escalating tensions between the countries.

title: Iranians Seek End To "Decades Of Repression": Reza Pahlavi Amid Protests
content: Iran's former Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi thanked US President Donald Trump for his support of the Iranian people, saying his message had given hope to those protesting against the country's leadership.

title: Zelensky Says He Wants To Replace Ukraine's Defence Minister
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday said he intended to replace his defence minister and had offered the position to his current minister of digital transformation, who is aged just 34.

title: Man Arrested In Bihar For Circulating AI-Generated Fake Videos Of PM, President
content: A man was arrested in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district on Friday for allegedly creating and circulating AI-generated fake videos and audio clips of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu, police said.

title: Haryana's Sex Ratio Rises To 923 In 2025, Highest In 5 Years
content: Haryana has seen a marked improvement in its sex ratio, which reached 923 in 2025, clocking a 13-point jump from 2024, with officials attributing the gain to several steps taken to check the practice of prenatal sex determination and illegal abortion

title: 8 Journalists, YouTubers Sentenced To Life By Pakistan Anti-Terror Court
content: A Pakistani anti-terrorism court sentenced eight journalists and social media commentators on Friday to life imprisonment in absentia after convicting them of terrorism-related offences.

title: FCS national championship preview: Illinois State, Montana State starving for title
content: NDSU came within 37 seconds of a national title in 2014 . the Bobcats came up three points short of the title . they're the first team to win four road games in a single playoff run . it's their first title game since the 2014 heartbreath of FCS .

title: CFP quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance and more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: Hype vs valuation: What really drives the IPO market
content: a general retail investor looks at the company's red herring prospectus . he looks at its performance, it's business model, if it‚Äôs a manufacturer then source of raw materials, clients (domestic/international), competition in market, comparison of share value / valuation with competitors .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
